column4: Anyone use Enlightenment or able to tell me how to install it?
sudo apt-get install enlightenment, or use synaptic
right click on menu, select edit menus... , and check if that item is disabled
Yeah, it's not listed there either.
gksudo /usr/sbin/gdmsetup
Thank you.
Okay, how do I change to GDM when it's currently using KDM?
not sure, maybe a sudo dpkg-reconfigure gdm would do it
Ah yeah... sorry.
no not at all
Well, I know a whois reports they are in the same state as me.... thought the first two sets of numbers being the same would mean we were using the same gateway, so-to-speak
no it doesn't mean that at all, especially with comcast, there are only 255 or less to a subnet, each subnet is a separate gateway
Oh... well crap.  Guess I'll just have to call them.  All I need is a city and I'd know who it was lol
you can tell more by doing an nslookup on the ip address, the string after the ip should be city and state
I don't see anything like that.
This is all it says after the IP: .hsd1.mi.comcast.net
guess it depends on the area then
And gmail doesn't include the sender's IP address so I can't compare it that way.... hmm
you probably want libqt4-dev or libqt3-mt-dev depending on which version it is using
it's probably in qt4-dev-tools
What does YOUR name have to do with Ubuntu?  Aren't YOU in the wrong channel? ;)
:D
